title: Battlefield
dialogue_triumphs: Mordred on the Brig: 'He is steeped in blood.'
The Doctor: 'Exotic alien swords are easy to come by… Aces are rare.'
The Brigadier: 'I just do the best I can.'
goofs: The scabbard is given huge emphasis, then ignored.
Mordred drinks at least four pints of real ale without apparent effect.
The Brigadier gives the Doctor a rather listless karate chop.
The Doctor obviously realises the futility of his command that UNIT 'lock up' Morgaine and her son.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: The Seventh incarnation of the Doctor, capable of hypnotizing humans and knocking them out with a touch.
continuity_notes.current_status: Carries various items including Liz Shaw's UNIT pass, his own pass, a catapult, and alien coinage.

continuity_notes.name: Ace
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's companion, formerly a student of Mrs Parkinson.

continuity_notes.name: Brigadier Lethbridge-Stewart
continuity_notes.description: Former UNIT leader, now married to Doris and no longer teaching.
continuity_notes.current_status: Called back into action for this adventure.

continuity_notes.name: UNIT
continuity_notes.description: United Nations Intelligence Taskforce, now equipped with various anti-alien weaponry.
continuity_notes.current_status: Active, with international troops including Czech, French, and Polish soldiers.

continuity_notes.name: Bessie
continuity_notes.description: The Third Doctor's yellow roadster, now with a changed number plate.
continuity_notes.current_status: Retrieved from storage for this adventure.

roots: Ace of Wands ('Seven Serpents, Sulphur and Salt')
The creature in Legend (for the Destroyer's appearance)

locations.name: Lake Vortigern, Carbury
locations.description: The main setting of the story, possibly in Wiltshire.
locations.current_status: Site of the battle between the Doctor and Morgaine's forces.

future_history: The story is set in a near-future world with a king, roadsigns in kilometres, £5 pieces, voice-operated phones, and inflated drink prices. It cannot be later than about 1995 given Zbrigniev's age.
untold_adventures: The Doctor's future incarnation as Merlin in a parallel universe, where he aided Arthur in battles against Morgaine, including the final battle at Badon around 1200 AD.
additional_notes: The episode features some of the first use of metaphor in Doctor Who, with the Destroyer personifying nuclear destruction.
bottom_line: Apart from the need for a few more immediate explanations, this stands up very well as a heroic action yarn with a charming final scene. Trying to do too much at once isn't the worst of sins, and we were cheering when it was first shown.
